meanings.definition: A person or thing that snaps.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was known as the fastest snappers in the class.
meanings.sent2: The camera captured the moment thanks to its quick snappers.
meanings.sent3: The snappers at the party were the ones who always made everyone laugh with their jokes.
meanings.sent4: The snappers of the crocodile were ready to catch any prey that came too close.
meanings.sent5: The snappers in the game were the ones who could quickly grab the falling objects.

meanings.sent1: The dentist checked the health of the patient's snappers.
meanings.sent2: She flashed a bright smile, showing off her pearly white snappers.
meanings.sent3: The snappers of the puppy were so sharp that they could chew through anything.
meanings.sent4: His snappers were like a row of white pearls, shining in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The snappers of the shark were fearsome, ready to tear into its prey.

meanings.sent1: The fishermen caught a variety of snappers during their trip.
meanings.sent2: The snappers in the aquarium swam gracefully among the coral.
meanings.sent3: The snappers in the sea were always a delight to watch with their colorful scales.
meanings.sent4: The snappers moved swiftly through the water, like flashes of silver.
meanings.sent5: The snappers were the stars of the underwater world, admired by all who saw them.

meanings.sent1: Grandma baked delicious snappers that were everyone's favorite.
meanings.sent2: The snappers on the plate were decorated with colorful sprinkles.
meanings.sent3: The snappers at the bake sale sold out quickly due to their irresistible aroma.
meanings.sent4: The snappers melted in her mouth, leaving a sweet aftertaste.
meanings.sent5: The snappers were the highlight of the dessert table, tempting all the guests.
